title: If no webapps deployed, accessing a URL returns 200 OK with no content instead of 404
description: When starting a Tomcat 7 instance with no webapps deployed, accessing a URL returns an HTTP code of 200 OK with no content, instead of returning an HTTP error 404. The issue can be reproduced by following the steps below:
OB: When accessing a URL on a Tomcat 7 instance with no webapps deployed, the server returns an HTTP code of 200 OK with no content.
EB: When accessing a URL on a Tomcat 7 instance with no webapps deployed, the server should return an HTTP error 404 indicating that the requested resource is not found.
SR:
1. Download the Tomcat 7 installation package from http://mirror.veriportal.com/apache/tomcat/tomcat7/v7.0.0beta/bin/apachetomcat7.0.0.zip
2. Install and start the Tomcat 7 instance with no webapps deployed.
3. Access a URL on the Tomcat instance.
4. Verify that the server returns an HTTP error 404 instead of a 200 OK response with no content.
